Selected Answer: D
La respuesta es la D, Network centric debido a que el GW se encuentra fuera de ACI y para APP-CENTRIC es requisito fundamental que el GW este en ACI Fabric.

Selected Answer: C
C. app centric
Network Centric approach is considered a soft transition for customers from traditional architecture to ACI architecture. This approach allows existing network architecture and flows to remain the same, henceforth allowing IT resources considerable amount of time to get acclimatized with the new terminologies of ACI fabric.
On the other hand, Application Centric approach is comparatively a new approach model where application tiers are defined by EPGs . In this setup, Application Profiles are created for each application with EPGs based on the application architecture tiers. The notion is to give the network administrator a view of the application, its connectivity & security requirement from the ACI fabric.

https://ipwithease.com/cisco-aci-network-centric-vs-application-centric-approach/

questions.question_text: Which protocol must be applied between the inter-pod network and spines within each pod to allow broadcast traffic replication between Cisco ACI pods?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Assuming the default BD configuration in which ARP flooding is enabled, ingress leaf encapsulates the incoming ARP with dIPo as the gIPo of the BD and sends it to a spine. And spine forwards it all receivers of the gIPo where the BD is activated and programmed. 

So in my opinion the answer is C

But if the ARP flooding is disabled with Hardware Proxy enabled, then yes ingress VTEP forwards it to anycast Spine VTEP as unicast and spine performs address lookup in COOP.
